files.description: Package initializer that exposes the public run entrypoint for the minimal pipeline.
Minimal runnable computational skeleton that deterministically writes /outputs/run_stamp.json and /outputs/run.log based on a stable input payload and environment details.
Artifact helpers for creating the outputs directory, writing canonical JSON, and appending structured log lines in a deterministic manner.
Command-line interface that invokes the pipeline run and ensures artifacts are produced with a predictable exit code.
Project configuration defining package metadata, dependencies, and pytest settings for running the minimal pipeline and tests.
Pytest test that runs the pipeline and asserts that /outputs/run_stamp.json and /outputs/run.log are created with expected structure and content.

missionDescription: Implement a minimal runnable computational skeleton that writes deterministic artifacts to /outputs/ (e.g., run_stamp.json + run.log) and add at least 1 pytest test that verifies artifact creation. Audit shows 0 test/execution results and execution previously failed ('No content received...').
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker
This closes the missing-validation gap by creating a stable execution path that can be tested and QA-checked, enabling reproducibility and preventing 'no runnable artifacts' outcomes.
